result.execSummary:
The defendant Will C Forward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay drug testing fees in the amount of $100

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug screening at the discretion of the agent 
--no possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the agent

The Court does not order submission of DNA sample, since Mr. Forward has submitted a sample previously.

Arresting Agency: LMPD


  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:16am [mo]
Defendant Will C Forward in court with Attorney Jennifer Lynn Weber.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance 

Mr. Forward waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived


Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #1 and #2.

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Weber 

On Count #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug screening at the discretion of the agent 
--no possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the agent
--to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay drug testing fees in the amount of $100

The Court does not order submission of DNA sample, since Mr. Forward has submitted a sample previously. 

Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess: 11:46am
With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Waiver of Prelim on May 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 12:08pm [mo]
Defendant Will C Forward in court with Attorney Jennifer Lynn Weber.  ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This case was scheduled for plea and sentencing today at 10:30am and Atty. Weber has submitted paperwork related to this. However due to calendar congestion Atty. Weber needs to request adjournment. 
The Court adjourns.
recess: 12:10pm

NEXT: Atty. Weber will contact JA for Plea and Sentencing date
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 24, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 9:37am[MO]
Defendant Will C Forward in court with Attorney Jennifer Lynn Weber.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Weber indicates this is the first Status Conference, since the Pretrial Conference.
Atty. Weber indicates she forsees a resolution in the near future and requests a Plea and Sentencing date in 3 weeks.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

recess:9:41

NEXT: Plea and Sentencing: 3/24/15 at 10:30am (JA--Please note in comments tht case is still at Prelim Stage)
Status conference on February 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 4, 2015 at 01:40 pm.

Case called at 1:17 pm [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Michael Onheiber presiding for BrII]
Defendant Will C Forward appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jennifer Lynn Weber. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Weber informs the Court that she is privately retained on matter

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Justin Bradt
Recess: 1:20 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 2/4/15 at 1:40 pm - Send notices (2) Future scheduling in BrI - Send notices
